summary:
Nice to meet you. Welcome to my profile!

My name is Sies and I'm a social, technical, philosophical and practical human from Eindhoven. I use my extended experience as a mechanical engineer and love for physical creation to make my own products and help others in realizing their designs. I enjoy finding out how things work and like finding answers to questions other people might have. 

Two days a week I create furniture with a team of people who are unemployed for various reasons. My job is to give them a sense of belonging while guiding them to become more and more skilled at making furniture. 

In my studio at Strijp S in Eindhoven, I can manufacture quite complex items using my own CNC milling machine and the available professional woodworking and metalworking equipment. 

In my spare time, I'm active in promoting sustainability; both professionally and voluntarily. Currently I am amongst others active in promoting an extremely efficient and affordable solar car (www.aptera.nu) as a voluntary ambassador. I also enjoy talking philosophy with everyone. Especially with kids.

I'm looking to collaborate with people who are aiming to add value and purpose to this world. Projects revolving arts, music, theater and sustainability have my interest.  

Do you have an interesting idea that you want to bring to life and could you use professional help with the technical realization? Please don't hesitate to contact me!

treasury_media.title: The mayor's desk
treasury_media.description: This custom made desk was designed by my colleague and me and produced under my lead at Uit de Buurtfabriek. The top and drawers are all made from reclaimed oak from an old wooden floor. Very happy customer and a proud team.

treasury_media.title: Teaching kids to engineer
treasury_media.description: At the Eindhoven library, I teach kids aged 7-12 how to bring their ideas to life. We start by asking them what they want to make and then assist them with the questions they have. The children learn to work autonomously, driven by a shared enthusiasm in technology. This solar house made by one of our youngest designers taught her to use various techniques, like soldering, 3D designing in Tinkercad and the basics of using the laser cutter.

treasury_media.title: Cabinet for Fontys Eindhoven - made with my team at Uit de Buurtfabriek
treasury_media.description: With my team of "Uit de Buurtfabriek" we make high quality custom furniture. Please consider choosing our social initiative for your woodworking job!

treasury_media.title: Curved chair
treasury_media.description: This chair was made with wood taken from my own dining room table. I've used an existing, old piece of furniture as inspiration, but gave it my own interpretation.

treasury_media.title: C-Sharp Customs "Black Beauty"
treasury_media.description: This was a relatively complex baritone guitar, which I designed and built on request.

treasury_media.title: Bones milled on my CNC
treasury_media.description: I regularly help artists from the Design Academy Eindhoven to realize their projects. In this case I used my CNC milling machine to mill a display of 3D bones for Marie Declerfayt (https://mariedeclerfayt.eu/).

treasury_media.title: Bark Free Boards
treasury_media.description:
Custom skateboards, which are completely produced in Eindhoven by Zoë Jacobs and myself. Zoë made the designs, I have created the production tools and process and we've done the production together. 

For sale for just €174,-

Contact me if you are interested in buying, or have a product idea you would like to see realized.

treasury_media.title: Cassette tape bow tie
treasury_media.description: A custom designed bow tie, made for an American director, who made the documentary "Cassette". It features small wheels, made from maple, glued into a coromandel base.

treasury_media.title: C#001-18 front
treasury_media.description: This guitar is the first completely custom built guitar by C#Customs. It features a European maple body, with a custom designed maple bridge with bone support plate for the saddles. The neck is made from a birdseye Canadian maple and features coromandel details.

treasury_media.title: C#001-18 back
treasury_media.description: The back of this first guitar emphasizes my specialties. A mix of engineering with design and high quality wood working. The cavities are made in such a way to maximize weight relief, while maintaining stiffness, sustain and weight balance.

patents.title: Actuator, lithographic apparatus, and actuator constructing method
Actuator, lithographic apparatus, and actuator constructing method
Design detail for better controlling thermal resistance of specific types of actuators.

awards.title: ASML Spot award
awards.description:
"With this award the ASML Management team would like to express its appreciation for successfully
developing new potting process LoS actuator.
[....]
Congratulations and thank you very much for your excellent contribution."

profile_positions.description: In the function of "maker" I organize creative workshops for children. The goal is to let children experience a creative learning experience, driven from their own curiosity. I support them in their quest by facilitating their technical needs and feeding suggestions if some direction is needed.
profile_positions.title: Maker

profile_positions.description:
“Uit de buurtfabriek” (literally: from the neighborhood factory) is a woodworking workshop in which I facilitate volunteers to build wooden products. Most of our volunteers are unemployed and value ’Uit de Buurtfabriek’ for its structure, atmosphere and contribution in terms of creating tangible value. 
I very much enjoy exchanging woodworking techniques and ways of life with my team.
profile_positions.title: Workshop Manager (2 days per week)

profile_positions.description:
My interest in and sense of responsibility towards preventing climate change has made me decide to take on a freelance part time job in doing LCA's (Life Cycle Analyses). In this role, I analyse the environmental impact of a product by collecting data such as used materials, energy usage, transport distances, waste streams etcetera. By using specialized software (Ecochain), we calculate a.o. the global warming potential, according to the latest international standards. 
The analysis leads to an advice on how to lower the impact of the product and in most cases in the publication of an Environmental Product Declaration (EPD). This EPD is an international, objective measure to be able to compare the environmental impact of different products. 
Since more and more customers such as governments are asking for these EPD's, companies are motivated to optimize their production to remain competitive. Since I strongly believe in the significance of this system, I'm motivated to help keep it in motion and push for improvements when possible.
profile_positions.title: Environmental impact analyst

profile_positions.description:
Working in high tech development projects. From making a list of demands to (concept) designing, prototyping, testing (a.o. functional qualification and lifetime testing) and introducing the (re)designs into the supply chain.

Main projects of the last 3 years have been (in chronological order):
- Redesigning a planar electric motor to be able to robustly withstand higher thermal and mechanical loads.
- Designing the tooling and assembly procedure for an other planar electric motor, with extra focus on improving the gluing processes.
- Supporting our service departments abroad (South Korea & Germany) on site for several months.
- Full mechanical design (concept & detail) of a linear actuator with gravity compensation function with very stringent mechanical, dynamical, electromechanical, thermal and safety requirements. This project meant being responsible for constantly balancing the design for optimized manufacturability, serviceability, reliability and cost while being able to meet all requirements. A lot of cooperation took place to align with stakeholders of interfacing modules and specialists who needed to provide information or perform actions on my behalf.
- Designing crash dampers, focussing on acquiring the exact load cases for proper qualification and assisting the supplier in building competence for products with rubber-metal adhesion, mainly with process and tooling reviews and supporting (thermo-)mechanical FEM analyses. This project ran in parallel with the linear actuator design.
profile_positions.title: Mechanical Engineer

profile_positions.description:
I received my Bachelors degree with a final project that I did for Total Support. The project was to individually find ways for cost reduction of a street sweeper truck. The job included a very elaborate mechanical FEM analysis of the full structure of the vehicle to locate those parts where the amount of material could be reduced. 
After this project I was offered a job and quite quickly ended up working for ASML which offered me to go on direct payroll later.
profile_positions.title: Mechanical Engineer

volunteer_experiences.description:
Driving two mentally challenged men to their weekly theatre rehearsal and participating in those rehearsals and in the plays. Our method is to try and show our real emotions, mainly based on improvisation. This creates an atmosphere of trust in which all actors, both mentally handicapped and "normal" feel comfortable in showing themselves and be the catalyst in the expression of the other actors. We work on subjects such as war, love and death and our plays have noticeable impact on our audience. 

Come see us! (www.carteblanche.nu)

Helping to create awareness of solar vehicle startup Aptera. This extremely efficient vehicle uses about 3 times less energy per kilometer than regular cars. I'm very motivated to support initiatives that radically reduce the waste of energy. Aptera is a company with which I share a lot of values. To promote them I'm active in providing information on social media and by writing articles on my enthusiast website.

Please check it out! https://www.aptera.nu
